ch.zhaw.hhrt.moodlightreferenceapp

Class Connection

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.zhaw.hhrt.moodlightreferenceapp.Connection

  • public class Connection
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles connection and data transfer with the Moodlight.
    Version:
    0.8 date 21.10.2016
    Author:
    Hanspeter Hochreutener, hhrt@zhaw.ch

    • Constructor Detail

      • Connection

        Connection(MainActivity activity)
        Connection handling The calling activity is informed of the connection status via callback functions.
        Parameters:
        activity - the calling activity

    • Method Detail

      • getStatus

        int getStatus()
        Check status of Moodlight connection
        Returns:
        status of Moodlight connection

      • findDevice

        boolean findDevice()
        Enable BluetoothAdapter and check if a device with the defined name is paired. Also sets the delimiter for end of data.
        Returns:
        true = BluetoothAdapter enabled and paired device found

      • connect

        void connect()
        Connects the Moodlight in a safe asynchronous way and opens input and output data streams.
        No return value here because the asynchronous task may take a while. The calling activity is informed via callback method connectionStatusChanged()
        See Also:
        connectionStatusChanged()

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
        Disconnects the Moodlight and closes input and output data streams.
        No return value here because this may take a while. The calling activity is informed via callback method connectionStatusChanged()
        See Also:
        connectionStatusChanged()

      • sendData

        boolean sendData(java.lang.String data)
        Send data to the Moodlight
        Parameters:
        data - the data to be sent
        Returns:
        true = sending was successful

      • listenForData

        private void listenForData()
        Listen for data from the Moodlight.
        When a String with a defined delimiter was received the method receivedData() in the calling activity is called
        See Also:
        receivedData()
